title: Creating a reading list of articles on simultaneous machine translation for speech recognition and synthesis involves selecting influential and relevant papers up to
Hereâ€™s a list that covers foundational work, advancements, and applications in this field
**"Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks"** by Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals
note: - Introduces the sequence-to-sequence model, foundational for translation tasks.

title: - Discusses the attention mechanism, crucial for improving translation quality
- Explores end-to-end models for speech recognition, relevant for integrating with translation systems
**"End-to-End Attention-based Large Vocabulary Speech Recognition"** by Chung-Cheng Chiu et al
- Focuses on attention-based models for speech recognition, a key component in simultaneous translation
- Discusses advancements in speech synthesis, important for the output phase of translation systems
- Introduces the Transformer model, which has become a standard in translation tasks
- Explores direct speech-to-text translation using neural networks
**"A Deep Reinforcement Learning Approach to Simultaneous Translation"** by Jiatao Gu et al
- Discusses using reinforcement learning for improving simultaneous translation
**"Real-time Speech Translation with Neural Machine Translation"** by Matthias Sperber et al
note: - Focuses on real-time translation challenges and solutions.

title: **"Direct Speech-to-Text Translation with Transformer"** by Ye Jia et al
- Explores using Transformer models for direct speech-to-text translation
**"Simultaneous Translation with Flexible Policy via Restricted Imitation Learning"** by Xutai Ma et al
note: - Discusses policy learning for simultaneous translation.

title: **"End-to-End Speech Translation with Transducer"** by Ankur Bapna et al
- Explores using transducer models for efficient speech translation
**"SimulSpeech: End-to-End Simultaneous Speech to Text Translation"** by Liang Ding et al
- Proposes a model for simultaneous speech-to-text translation
**"Real-Time Neural Speech Translation for Live Subtitling: From Deployment to Projection Mapping"** by Matthias Sperber et al
note: - Discusses practical deployment of speech translation systems.

title: **"Streaming End-to-End Speech Recognition for Mobile Devices"** by Tara N. Sainath et al
note: - Focuses on streaming models, relevant for real-time applications.

title: **"Jointly Learning to Align and Translate with Transformer Models"** by Minh-Thang Luong et al
note: - Explores joint learning approaches in translation.

title: **"Simultaneous Translation with Delayed Reinforcement Learning"** by Baigong Zheng et al
- Discusses reinforcement learning techniques for handling delays in translation
**"Speech Recognition and Synthesis as a Service"** by Alex Graves et al
- Early work on integrating speech recognition and synthesis in service models
**"Improving Simultaneous Speech Translation by Incorporating Punctuation Information"** by Yuchen Liu et al
- Explores the role of punctuation in improving translation quality
- Discusses challenges and strategies in developing neural models for simultaneous translation
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the developments in simultaneous machine translation for speech recognition and synthesis up to
